summary: SummaryMario Badescu's Glycolic Foaming Cleanser is an exfoliating, foaming face wash with AHAs that deep cleans, resurfaces, and refines uneven skin tone and texture.
details: DetailsBenefitsLightly lathering gelResurfaces, refines, and deep cleansHelps improve the look of uneven skin tone, texture, and fine linesPromotes bright, rejuvenated skinTo be used 1-3 times per week in place of a daily cleanserItem 2209926How To UseReplace your regular cleanser 1-3 times a week (1-2 times for Dry to Combination skin, and 2-3 times for Combination and Oily skin). Massage onto wet skin using upward, circular motions, then rinse thoroughly with warm water. Not to be used as a daily face wash.Not recommended for use with topical prescriptions, acne-erupted, or sensitive skin. Avoid contact with the eyes. If contact occurs, rinse well with water. If irritation develops and persists, discontinue use. Sunburn Alert: This product contains an alpha hydroxy acid (AHA) that may increase your skin's sensitivity to the sun and particularly the possibility of sunburn. Use a sunscreen, wear protective clothing, and limit sun exposure while using this product and for a week afterwards.IngredientsSodium Lauryl Sulfate, Aqua (Water, Eau), Cocamidopropyl Betaine, Cocamide MEA, Glycolic Acid, Salvia Officinalis (Sage) Leaf Extract, Hypericum Perforatum Extract, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Extract, Althaea Officinalis Leaf/Root Extract, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Sodium Chloride, Parfum (Fragrance), Propylene Glycol, Methylparaben, Propylparaben, Diazolidinyl Urea.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Replace your regular cleanser 1-3 times a week (1-2 times for Dry to Combination skin, and 2-3 times for Combination and Oily skin). Massage onto wet skin using upward, circular motions, then rinse thoroughly with warm water. Not to be used as a daily face wash.Not recommended for use with topical prescriptions, acne-erupted, or sensitive skin. Avoid contact with the eyes. If contact occurs, rinse well with water. If irritation develops and persists, discontinue use. Sunburn Alert: This product contains an alpha hydroxy acid (AHA) that may increase your skin's sensitivity to the sun and particularly the possibility of sunburn. Use a sunscreen, wear protective clothing, and limit sun exposure while using this product and for a week afterwards.

reviews.headline: Economical, Derm Recommended, Works Great
reviews.comments: My dermatologist recommended I use a glycolic cleanser - this is the best I've found!  Here's why:  cost-effective, only need a small amount, works great.  Nothing I don't like about it!!

reviews.headline: My eyes!
reviews.comments: Holly heck! This stuff needs a big warning label saying don't use on your face. During my full face rinse, after washing, I've gotten tiniest residue in my eyes. It burns so bad! This is going in the trash!

reviews.headline: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE
reviews.comments: I have used this for years. It leaves my skin soft and radiant and doesn't dry out my already dry skin. I use this 2-3 times a week for dull, mature skin.

reviews.headline: Damage skin
reviews.comments: This was the worst skin care that I have ever purchased, my skin is totally damage, irritated and burnâ€¦ it is so bad, that I can't use any other than Vaseline.

reviews.headline: happy with results
reviews.comments: I usually use this after I've removed my makeup with the cleansing oil. I like that it leaves a very clean feel to my skin without drying or tightness. It also rinses off well.

reviews.headline: HARD TO GET OUT - Bottle clogs easily
reviews.comments: LOVE this product but won't buy it again bc I hate the bottle so much. The tube where it comes out gets clogged really easily and every use becomes a fight to the death to get it out. Washing your face shouldn't fill you with rage but here we are.

reviews.headline: Dry, sensitive skin
reviews.comments: I'll admit that on the first use, it did sting a little. After that it's been working great! I've been using this to clean, a moisturizer, then seaweed night cream/vitamin c cream depending on time of day. Before I was using Clinique Mild Soap and that left me dry the moment I finished rinsing. This one leaves me a little more moisturized and requires less (gentle) scrubbing!

reviews.headline: Changed formulation
reviews.comments: I've used rhis for YEARS. Something has changed. The color of the cleanser is different and it does not foam the way it used to. Worst of all, it broke me out terribly. Sad about this one.

reviews.headline: I was skeptical at first
reviews.comments: I was using philosophy for years and decided I needed to switch to something more affordable and that works well for my skin. I wanted to give it good run because whenever you switch your skin care it takes you skin about 2 to 8 weeks to get used to something new but my skin got accumulated to in within 3 and of course there were breakouts but once my skin got used to it, I've felt more moisturized and had less dry batches, my skin became more clear and this was surprising since my skin is normally so sensitive, but so far so good. I'll be looking to use more products from this brand.

reviews.headline: Simple, effective cleanser
reviews.comments:
I am 49 and have skin that gets mildly dry in winter. I have some sun spots and acne scars, rosacea on my nose, forehead frown lines, and general puffiness around my eyes. Otherwise I always get compliments on my skin and I think it does look younger than its age!

I'm on a budget and trying to to keep a minimal routine, with products that are flexible for a 4-season climate.

I was previously using a CeraVe cleanser that gets the job done, but leaves my skin a bit blah-looking and not feeling quite right texturally. I decided to splurge for my birthday and try this product.

I LOVE that it has no noticeable scent! 

So far (winter) the cleanser is working great I and see no cons. I believe this product will also work well in summer's high humidity. It seems to be minimizing all of my skin issues listed above.

I use a pea-sized amount of this cleanser at night and most mornings for clean, soft, bright skin. I apply it to damp skin with my fingers, then massage and remove with a soft wet wash cloth. At night I follow with either a retinol serum or The Ordinary Multi-Peptide serum, then MB's seaweed night cream. In the morning, I use this cleanser *only* if I did not use retinol the night before. On post-retinol mornings, I only wash with a warm wet cloth (I might also wipe nose and chin with a bit of toner). My morning products are MBs vitamin C serum and Hydro moisturizer (and I usually skip day moisturizer in summer, it just sweats off in the humidity).

I have not experienced any irritation with this cleanser, but I wonder if reviewers who have found it irritating are either combining it with a retinoid or trying to remove makeup with this? I'm no chemist, but this cleanser doesn't feel to me like its purpose is makeup or mask removal - it doesn't have enough slip for that and might turn abrasive. I remove makeup/masks with coconut oil or an oily cleanser first, then wash with this glycolic cleanser to clarify. 

I wouldn't recommend this product for daily use by people with moderate to very dry skin, but it might work nicely for a weekly clarify. I definitely do recommend for folks with oily, normal, or mildly dry skin. I had oily skin with cystic acne when I was younger, and I think this would have worked so much better than the harsh products being sold back then that actually increased oil production and made those issues worse.

reviews.headline: I love the feel of my skin I'd repurchase this product
reviews.comments: I use a dime size on a wet skin . Work it into a lather and remove with water. My skin is dry. I use it 3 times per week. My skin has never been so smoothe. On other days I use Mario Badescu foaming cleanser.

reviews.headline: A favorite
reviews.comments: This has been my favorite face wash for a few years now, so much so that my husband doesn't have to even ask where it is in the store, I always ask for it on every occasion. I'd recommend this for someone with normal to oily skin, when I'm a little on the drier side I need

reviews.headline: Best cleanser for me
reviews.comments: I had been using Dermalogica for years-switched to this, glad I did.   No issues.  :-)

reviews.headline: Burns my eyes even when avoiding area
reviews.comments: Strong cleanser. Irritates my eyes even when I avoid that area. Still undecided whether I love it or not.

reviews.headline: My Favorite Cleanser in which Keeps my Skin Clear
reviews.comments: I've been using this for 2 years or a little more. I tried everything that I possibly could. I wanted something other than drugstore cleansers and somehow saw this product/brand. It took me a while to give it a try considering the price. I'm happy I made the change. I have hormonal ingrown hairs and extremely dark spots on my jawline and under my chin due to tweezing. This has lightened the spots over 2 years. It also dries out any bumps which I rarely get because I use this. I also think it's an excellent exfoliator. It helps keep my skin so clear it has also caused me to appear a little brighter and lighter. I also leave this one sometimes on my jawline only. Of course, I use the body cleanser now and other items from Mario Badescu, this is my absolute favorite cleanser.

reviews.headline: Horrible
reviews.comments: My skin looks worst than it did before I started using this cleanser. It made me breakout in places I've never had acne before.

reviews.headline: works great, helped clear skin
reviews.comments: Helped deep clean my pores and melt excess sebum. My skin is clear and radiant, haven't had any issues with reactions or burning sensation. Really gets the grime off after a long day.

reviews.headline: Great cleanser!
reviews.comments: I love this cleanser and use it once a day every morning with a very soft face cleansing brush. It gets all of the gunk out of my pores and preps my skin for the rest of my routine. It leaves my skin clean but not dry, and I've had no irritation. The price is good too. It's probably not ideal for dry or sensitive skin, but if your skin isn't sensitive, a little on the oily side, and you have noticeable pores, this is a great cleanser.

reviews.headline: Good Quality
reviews.comments: I used to use only Aveda products for 30 + years.  One day I tried this product as I was low on cash.  I do not miss my Aveda cleanser.  I have now been using this face cleanser for 1 1/2 years.

reviews.headline: Yes
reviews.comments: Have used for years and will continue to do so.

media.headline: OMG! IN LOVE... MIRACLE WORKER
media.caption: before bed on day 6 same side of face

media.headline: OMG! IN LOVE... MIRACLE WORKER
media.caption: This is after Day 3 the break out was even worse!

faceoff_positive.comments:
I originally went in for another product and ended up leaving with this. I have EXTREMELY dry and sensitive skin, lately I've been under an immense amount of stress so have been breaking out worse then I ever have in my life! My esthetician told me that glycolic acid could potentially help with scaring and build up of dry dead skin cells. 

I use This every third night followed by the gycolic acid toner, the rest of the time I have been using Mario Badescu Seaweed cleanser and toner! I use a dry skin formulated moisturizer. I have also been taking a supplement l-lysine to help prevent breakouts from starting.

Between the two they have completely reduced all redness and inflammation, my break out is slowly subsiding and the scarring is fading, all the awful scabs have slowly been shedding leaving healthier looking skin under... I have been using this regimen for 6 days!!! my skin feels smooth and their is a drastic reduction in redness everyday. It feel healthy and happy <3 <3 

I am a believer THANK YOU MARIO BADESCU <3
faceoff_positive.headline: OMG! IN LOVE... MIRACLE WORKER

faceoff_negative.comments: After reading hundreds of great reviews, I really wanted to love this product. I have oily/acne prone skin and I had finally managed to control my acne when I decided to try this product to lighten up my scars. It was a horrible mistake. Instead, I broke out with painful cystic acne all over my checks and jaw line. At first I stuck to it because I thought I was "purging," but after about 5 weeks of use, it wasn't getting any better and I was still breaking out. I won't give up on MB completely, I have used their seaweed cleanser with no issues, but the glycolic face cleanser was just not for me. I have stopped using it and praying my skin recovers soon!!
faceoff_negative.headline: Broke Me Out with Horrible Cystic Acne
